item.title: What is scar?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

IP-Drowner:

There are some non-English speakers who are quite good at programming. Maybe he had searched and no results had come up. Likely he had searched this forum, and nowhere else.

That’s arguable. Anyway besides you, who said anything about his English? If he won’t help himself to understand what scar is, he isn’t going to help himself to write scripts for scar. There are plenty of other ways other than the search button, including browsing, stickies, and google.

Read full topic

item.title: What is scar?

It’s just quite immature to act like the guy who’s asking for help. Obviously he needs it, so we should answer his question instead of fooling around
[/quote]

Do you seriously think this guy is going to take the information, and use it to learn scar/pascal? If he couldn’t help himself enough to find out what it even is, what makes you think he will help himself enough to learn how to use it?

oh and magma should stop taking things so seriously.[/quote]
There are some non-English speakers who are quite good at programming. Maybe he had searched and no results had come up. Likely he had searched this forum, and nowhere else.

I herd it was a cheet 4 roonskape were u get fre moneys
[/quote]
no wtf, it duz qwest for u an u need no items, u can do monkey medness at lvl 2[/quote]

That’s just immature.

If you want to learn how to script scar, it’s probably more useful to learn pascal first, and then scar will be easy once you have the basic methods.

Read full topic

item.title: What is scar?
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

It is a scriptable client, based off the Pascal programming language. It stands for Shit Compared to AutoRune and was originally created by Kaitnieks, but is now being continued in development by Freddy1990.

It can do all sorts of things a human could do, but some of those extremely complex things, well, are complex So, there you go.

Read full topic
